Garett Moreau üá∫üá∏
Garett Moreau üá∫üá∏
postsData.content:
"If confirmed, this breach would be one of the largest leaks of AI-generated conversation data, exposing users to identity theft, phishing scams, and financial fraud."

OmniGPT integrates various advanced language models, including ChatGPT-4, Claude 3.5, Perplexity, Google Gemini, and Midjourney, into a single interface.

Designed to enhance efficiency, it offers features *including* data encryption.
But stuff happens.

Some of the consequences of this hack would include Identity Theft, Phishing, and API Key Exploitation. Know your chatbot! (You may want to try out Perplexity who seem to have a good security track record so far.)

comments.commentText: This is incredibly scary and damaging to everyone exposed. IT security is more important than ever and services like Augury IT will safeguard and protect your peace of mind.

postsData.commentAdded: Its crucial to stay aware of security risks in AI tools. Prioritizing encryption and vetting platforms can help protect our data! #CyberSecurity

postsData.content:
-35¬∞C or not, when you have a guest speaker like Nicole Berg at the 722 Breakfast Club, you show up. 

And she did not disappoint! An internationally recognized, multi-award-winning coach and social enterprise founder, Nicole doesn‚Äôt just identify gaps‚Äîshe creates breakthroughs. With 13 coaching awards and a track record of working with Fortune Global 10-500 leaders, she‚Äôs transformed teams across industries, from biotech to finance. She‚Äôs led game-changing initiatives, including a $75K charity campaign and a call-in movement that helped restart provincial negotiations.

Nicole also walked us through the five rhetorical appeals‚Äîlogos, ethos, pathos, kairos, and telos‚Äîshowing us how to leverage them to engage with the media effectively. Her ability to connect, persuade, and drive action is what makes her a force in leadership, coaching, and social impact. "You gave us what we wanted‚Äîand what we didn‚Äôt know we needed."

Thanks for your time today Nicole!
postsData.commentAdded: Incredible insights, Nicole! Your ability to inspire and empower leaders is truly remarkable. Thanks for sharing your expertise with us! #Leadership #Coaching

postsData.name:
Arvind Jain
Arvind Jain
postsData.content:
Up until this point, we‚Äôve only just scratched the surface of what‚Äôs possible with AI. Glean‚Äôs vision is to empower everyday users and developers to create AI agents to automate personal tasks and business processes at scale.

Over the past year,has performed 50+ million agent actions in enterprises. Notable examples include's career growth analysis agent,'s personalized sales outreach app, and's askT concierge for employee IT and HR needs.

Today, we‚Äôre proud to be taking Glean one step further into the agentic era with the launch of Glean Agents‚Äîour horizontal agent environment for building, deploying, orchestrating, and governing AI agents across the enterprise.

With Glean Agents, companies can manage and govern thousands of agents, helping employees embrace AI in a compliant, safe way at scale.

It offers a user-friendly, natural language interface for building agents, connected to the broadest access to work data and world knowledge and a comprehensive slate of orchestrated actions.

We‚Äôre also introducing new platform capabilities integrated into Glean Agents:
 Universal knowledge: At work, we often switch between using internal and external data. Users can combine enterprise data with internet data, enabling the integration of online information, such as real-time industry insights, directly into Glean queries. Glean now provides the broadest and most comprehensive set of knowledge for work AI.

 Structured data analysis: When it comes to leveraging all the data in the enterprise, structured data is a piece of the puzzle that most AI solutions have yet to crack. Now, Glean‚Äôs universal knowledge capabilities are compatible with both structured and unstructured data, enabling users to bring data to every decision using natural language queries from a first set of structured data applications -,, and Jira.

Active data and AI governance: AI is most useful when broadly-connected to corporate data, and we‚Äôve offered comprehensive support for permissions from day one to protect enterprise data. We‚Äôre now introducing a new layer of governance that continuously protects against accidentally overshared data in the enterprise.

Putting AI in the hands of every employee is the most pragmatic way to drive AI transformation.

AI agents enable each employee to not only redefine their own productivity, but to build new AI-powered business processes that deliver top-line results for the organization: increased revenue, higher CSAT, and faster engineering time-to-market for new capabilities.

Read more on these updates on our blog:and be sure to tune into Glean Live at 10am PT to get the first look at Glean Agents. Link to register in the comments.

comments.commentText: Watch Glean Live: Winter ‚Äò25 today at 10am PT Ô∏è https://okt.to/tywkb9
YES Arvind Jain!!!

postsData.commentAdded: Exciting times ahead with Glean Agents! Empowering employees to harness AI for enhanced productivity is a game changer. Cant wait to see the impact!

postsData.name:
Gunjan Arora
Gunjan Arora
postsData.content:
Unlocking Wipro Pvt Ltd‚Äôs Financial Story through Data Visualization... 

With the esteemed guidance of Rohit Sood Sir, I conducted a detailed financial analysis of Wipro Pvt Ltd, leveraging advanced spreadsheet tools and visualization techniques to transform raw data into powerful insights. This project demonstrated how data visualization can revolutionize financial decision-making and strategy formulation.

" Financial Overview Dashboard: Wipro Pvt Ltd (2020-2024)

 Column Chart: Revenue growth from 2020 to 2024
 Pie Chart: Profit distribution analysis
 Line Chart: Expenses trend
 Bar Chart: EPS growth
 Line Chart: Net Cash Flow fluctuations
 Column Chart: Working Capital trends
Link of my excel file:-

Key Highlights
 Revenue Growth: Consistent increase in revenue from 2020 to 2024, reflecting strong business expansion.
 Profit Margins: Stable profitability with a notable upward trend in recent years.
 Cash Flow Insights: Operating cash flow remains robust, while investing cash flow highlights strategic investments.
 Expense Analysis: Effective cost management visible through a steady expense ratio.
 EPS Growth: Continuous improvement in Earnings Per Share, indicating enhanced shareholder value.
Takeaways:-
Data-Driven Insights: Visualization simplifies financial data interpretation, enabling quicker and smarter decisions.
Trend Analysis: Helps identify patterns in revenue, profit, and expenses for better forecasting.
Strategic Focus: Cash flow trends guide investment and financing strategies.
Enhanced Financial Storytelling: Combining multiple charts improves understanding and stakeholder communication.

comments.commentText: Impressive!

postsData.commentAdded: Impressive work! Your insightful analysis and visualization techniques showcase how data can truly transform financial decision-making. Well done!

postsData.name:
CXO TechBOT
CXO TechBOT
postsData.content:
Yotta Data Services Private Limited has launched myShakti, India‚Äôs first fully sovereign B2C generative AI chatbot, marking a major milestone in the nation‚Äôs AI journey. Built on DeepSeek‚Äôs open-source model and operating entirely on Indian servers, myShakti reinforces India‚Äôs AI self-reliance, ensuring data security, privacy, and affordability.

Led by @Darshan Hiranandani , this initiative represents a transformative step in India‚Äôs AI innovation, offering an indigenous alternative to global AI solutions.Co-founder & CEO of Yotta, describes this as a ‚ÄúSputnik moment for AI,‚Äù highlighting India‚Äôs growing influence in the global AI landscape.

Meanwhile,'shas also integrated DeepSeek models into its cloud infrastructure, positioning itself as a key player in affordable AI solutions. With Krutrim promising the lowest AI pricing in the world, India is rapidly emerging as a global AI powerhouse.

As the nation accelerates its efforts in AI development and adoption, could myShakti be the turning point in India‚Äôs AI dominance? This launch signals a new era of homegrown AI solutions, solidifying India‚Äôs place in the global AI revolution.

comments.commentText: We wish you all the best Yotta Data Services Private Limited Darshan Hiranandani
I am waiting for Deepseek R1-671 B model...

postsData.commentAdded: Congratulations to Yotta Data Services on launching myShakti! This innovative step is a game-changer for Indias AI landscape. Excited for the future!

Garett Moreau üá∫üá∏
Garett Moreau üá∫üá∏
postsData.content:
NEW: Kimsuky, the North Korea-linked hacker group, is adopting a new tactic: deceiving victims into running malicious PowerShell commands.

(This method tricks targets into executing harmful code that allows remote access and data theft.)

Just 5 days ago they had been observed conducting spear-phishing attacks to deliver an information stealer malware named forceCopy. The use of tools RDP Wrapper and proxies to commandeer infected hosts points to a tactical shift for Kimsuky, which has historically leveraged bespoke backdoors for this purpose.

"All of the paths where the malware is installed are web browser installation paths."

Active since at least 2012, Kimusky has a track record of orchestrating "tailored social engineering attacks that are capable of bypassing email security protections.
postsData.commentAdded: Impressive insights! Kimsukys evolving tactics highlight the critical need for robust cybersecurity measures and user awareness. Stay vigilant!

Oman‚Äôs new Part-Time Work Regulations are setting the stage for a more dynamic and flexible labor market. By balancing employer flexibility with employee protections like minimum wages and social security, these changes aim to empower Omani nationals while advancing Omanisation goals. This shift is a blueprint for a more adaptive workforce.

Get into the details in the full article!


Note: From now on, all Global Mobility and HR Legal Updates will be published on my Substack‚Äîyour go-to source for insights on employment law, HR trends, and mobility updates across the Middle East and Asia.

postsData.name:
Martin Rowinski
Martin Rowinski
postsData.content:
When I bring on a new person‚Äîespecially someone who‚Äôs going to be my right hand on a project‚ÄîI don‚Äôt micromanage.

I don‚Äôt tell them exactly what to do.

Instead, I say: ‚ÄúHere‚Äôs what I‚Äôm thinking. I‚Äôd love your ideas on how we can make this system better.‚Äù

Because when you give people ownership, they step up.

I recently did this with our B2B team, and let me tell you‚Äîshe‚Äôs absolutely crushing it.

She didn‚Äôt just follow instructions.

She reinvented everything we had built six years ago.

She streamlined processes.

She improved efficiency.

She made things better‚Äîin ways I hadn‚Äôt even considered.

And when she realized she had that trust, she said, ‚ÄúOh my gosh, you‚Äôre really giving me this opportunity?‚Äù

And my response? Yes.

Because leadership isn‚Äôt about controlling every step.

It‚Äôs about creating space for ownership, innovation, and growth.

Give your people trust.

Give them the room to make an impact.

You might be surprised at what they come up with.

How do you empower your team to take ownership?
postsData.commentAdded: Great approach! Empowering team members fosters innovation and drives exceptional results. Trust truly unlocks their potential! üí™üöÄ

postsData.name:
Hamza Ullah
Hamza Ullah
postsData.content:
Understand event loop in simple words!

 ùó¶ùó∂ùóªùó¥ùóπùó≤-ùóßùóµùóøùó≤ùóÆùó±ùó≤ùó± ùóòùòÖùó≤ùó∞ùòÇùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª:
-JavaScript operates in a single-threaded environment, meaning it processes one thing at a time.
-But thanks to the event loop, it doesn't get stuck waiting on things like user input or timers.

ùóñùóÆùóπùóπùóØùóÆùó∞ùó∏ ùó§ùòÇùó≤ùòÇùó≤:
-When asynchronous operations (like setTimeout or fetch requests) complete, their associated callback functions don‚Äôt execute immediately.
-Instead, they get placed into a callback queue, where they‚Äôll wait for their turn.

ùó™ùó≤ùóØ ùóîùó£ùóúùòÄ:
-JavaScript hands off certain tasks, like network requests or timers to Web APIs (provided by the browser).
-These APIs process tasks outside the main JavaScript thread, allowing the main thread to keep running while waiting for these operations to finish.

ùó†ùó∂ùó∞ùóøùóºùòÅùóÆùòÄùó∏ùòÄ ùó§ùòÇùó≤ùòÇùó≤:
-Aside from the callback queue, there‚Äôs also the microtasks queue, which holds tasks with higher priority, such as promises that have been resolved.
-Microtasks must be executed before anything in the callback queue.

ùóòùòÉùó≤ùóªùòÅ ùóüùóºùóºùóΩ'ùòÄ ùó•ùóºùóπùó≤:
-The event loop is like a coordinator. It continuously checks whether the call stack is clear. Once it‚Äôs empty, it first looks at the microtasks queue, ensuring that high priority tasks are handled first. Only after the microtasks queue is empty does it start picking tasks from the callback queue.

ùóñùóÆùóπùóπ ùó¶ùòÅùóÆùó∞ùó∏:
-The call stack is where the magic happens. It holds the functions that are currently being executed. Functions are added to the stack when they‚Äôre called and removed once they‚Äôve been completed.
-If the call stack is busy, the event loop will wait for it to be free.

ùóõùóºùòÑ ùóúùòÅ ùóîùóπùóπ ùó™ùóºùóøùó∏ùòÄ ùóßùóºùó¥ùó≤ùòÅùóµùó≤ùóø:
-To summarize the process: the event loop keeps the call stack clear by processing microtasks first, then moving on to the callback queue.
-This allows JavaScript to handle asynchronous code efficiently while maintaining responsiveness.

‚≠ê The event loop lets JavaScript perform non-blocking operations, ensuring tasks are executed in the right order without blocking the main thread.

Followfor daily learning and getting better

comments.commentText: Insightful
Korrapati Jaswanth üáÆüá≥ thank you Ô∏è

postsData.commentAdded: Great breakdown of the event loop! Understanding these concepts is key to mastering asynchronous JavaScript. Keep sharing these insights! üöÄ

postsData.content:
The craziest memecoin story you‚Äôll read today: $378 in ‚Üí $119K out ‚Üí $200K back in.

Most people cash out and run when they make a 31,400% return on a meme coin.

But not this time.

This is how $JAILSTOOL flipped the script on everything we know about memecoins. 

It started as a joke.

founder Dave Portnoy threw $378 into a random meme coin.

No roadmap. No whitepaper. Just chaos.

Then, the unexpected happened: his tiny bet skyrocketed to $119K. 

Then came the mistake.

Instead of holding, Portnoy sold.

 Everything gone.

The bag? Dumped.
The gains? Realised.

Most people would walk away.

A 31,400% return? Insane.

Time to take the W and move on.

But instead, he did the opposite.

He FOMO‚Äôd back in HARD.

Portnoy didn‚Äôt just rebuy a little, he dropped over $200K to load back up on $JAILSTOOL.

And that‚Äôs when things got crazy.

 HODL pledge ‚Äì He committed to holding until $1B market cap.

 $100K reinvestment for every $100M milestone ‚Äì Putting his own money into the project.

 JAILSTOOL merch launch ‚Äì Profits from merch? Going straight back into the coin.

 Rewarding creativity ‚Äì Just sent $100K worth of $JAILSTOOL to the best ad he received.

Memecoins aren‚Äôt supposed to work like this, but here we are.

 It triggered FOMO
 It built massive trust.
 It created a viral moment.
 It proved demand instantly.

Is this a genius play or just meme coin madness? Drop your take below. 

Ô∏è Less rugs, more fun. Spread the word.
Followandfor more insights.

postsData.content:
ùêñùê°ùê® ùêÉùê® ùêòùê®ùêÆ ùêìùê´ùêÆùê¨ùê≠ ùêåùê®ùê´ùêû? ùêÄùêà ùê®ùê´ ùêíùê®ùêúùê¢ùêöùê• ùêåùêûùêùùê¢ùêö? 

A new study from Rutgers University just confirmed something wild‚Ä¶ Americans trust AI more than social media. 

Yep, AI scores higher in trust than Congress too. (Though, let‚Äôs be honest‚Ä¶ not the highest bar. )

ùêáùêûùê´ùêû ùêöùê´ùêû ùê¨ùê®ùê¶ùêû ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùêßùê† ùê≠ùêöùê§ùêûùêöùê∞ùêöùê≤ùê¨:
 Young men trust AI the most.
 Urban folks are more comfortable with AI than rural residents.
 Educated and high-earning individuals are more confident in AI.
 Only 13% of people feel ‚Äúvery confident‚Äù in spotting AI-generated content.
But here‚Äôs the kicker‚Ä¶ 62% still trust human journalists more than AI-generated news. 

ùêñùê°ùêöùê≠ ùêÉùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêìùê°ùê¢ùê¨ ùêåùêûùêöùêß ùêüùê®ùê´ ùêåùêöùê´ùê§ùêûùê≠ùêûùê´ùê¨?
1Ô∏è‚É£ AI is a tool, not a replacement. People still crave human connection in content.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Transparency wins. Being clear about how you use AI can build trust.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Know your audience. If you‚Äôre targeting younger, educated, or urban consumers, AI-powered solutions may resonate more.

Bottom line? AI is gaining trust, but human touch still matters.

What do you think? Would you trust an AI-generated article over a human-written one? Drop your thoughts in the comments! 

Ô∏è Repost to inspire someone in your network.
 Follow me ‚Üí @shaikhsahed for more!
postsData.commentAdded: Fascinating insights! Its clear that while AI is gaining trust, the human touch remains irreplaceable in communication. What‚Äôs your take on balancing both?

postsData.name:
Jake Dunlap
Jake Dunlap
postsData.content:
ChatGPT is not cheating - it's the next "google" that your sales team should be using it 2-3 hours a day

Had 86 out of 90 sellers in a session raise their hand that they are using it weekly/daily

Had all 86 sellers in the same session put their hand down when I asked "Has your leader or company provided real training on how to use it?"

Leaders - I'm pivoting almost our entire RevOps practice to focus on GenAI deployments and implementations.

I'm pivoting an 8 figure business this year because I can see the future of B2B sales. This is it. This will disrupt how we sell and how people buy so much faster than we can comprehend.

If you team is still using Google for research, if they still have to meet with a manager to get basic deal advice, you are costing your team at least 5-10 hours a week of productivity gains. This is an amazing time and time to get rid of "what got me here" and focus on "where we need to get to"

comments.commentText: I wouldn‚Äôt use a toaster made without regulation and warranty. Good luck living in the lawless Wild West. I won‚Äôt be playing.
Derek Wyszynski I mean‚Ä¶it‚Äôs better than having to go to a library or read an encyclopedia

Jake Dunlap at the library I‚Äôm assured the stuff I look up is actually real. I was watching ‚ÄúArthur‚Äù on Criterion and decided to look up Dudley Moore‚Äôs filmography. Wiki was great and was IMDb. In the third search result, this AI written article appeared. Like I said - good luck‚Ä¶

Yup, the next "google" is a good way to put it. Like many AI applications very dependent on human interaction, AI for sales is most valuable for the easiest, fastest aspects of sales roles and corresponding activities. No one should be calling a better way to google cheating.

So far the most complex, social aspects of sales are still most effectively done by humans. I don't think that's a bad thing, because sales is an amazing profession for humans worth spending time / energy on.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Embracing GenAI is crucial for future sales success. Its time to innovate and empower our teams with the right tools! üöÄ

postsData.name:
Phil Donaldson
Phil Donaldson
postsData.content:
Using intent signals to trigger your sales outreach? I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but‚Ä¶

You're late!

90% of buyers choose a vendor that was on their short list at the beginning of the sales process

If you're not in at the beginning, you're very unlikely to win.

A study by Harvard Business Review found that around 90% of the time B2B buyers go with their day-one list.

That means a narrow window of opportunity for your sales team. If you‚Äôre not on the buyer‚Äôs list from the get-go, your chances of winning the deal evaporate dramatically.

Consider this...

 PEOPLE TRUST WHAT THEY KNOW
If buyers haven‚Äôt heard of you, they‚Äôre not even considering you, my friend. Familiarity builds trust. If you‚Äôre not showing up in search results (regular and AI-assisted), industry discussions and analyst reports, you‚Äôre The Invisible Vendor.

 EDUCATION BEATS PERSUASION
Buyers don‚Äôt want to be sold to. They want a trusted guide. The vendors shaping the conversation before the buying process starts are the ones making the shortlist. If you‚Äôre waiting for them to raise their hand, you‚Äôre most likely too late.

 DECISIONS ARE MADE BY COMMITTEES, NOT INDIVIDUALS
An average of 13+ stakeholders weigh in on tech purchases. If someone in finance, IT, or operations prefers a familiar vendor, that vendor gets a head start. You need to influence the whole team ‚Äî before the RFP even drops.

 PAST EXPERIENCE TRUMPS THE PERFECT PRODUCT
Buyers stick with what they know. If someone on the committee has worked with a vendor before, that vendor has a major advantage. If you‚Äôre the new player, you need to earn trust early ‚Äî long before they start shopping.

 SO, HOW DO YOU BREAK IN?
Be seen BEFORE buyers start looking. Build brand awareness early.
Share insights that shape how buyers think about their challenges.
Engage with all stakeholders ‚Äî not just decision-makers.

Make sure your expertise is everywhere it can be ‚Äî search, industry conversations, AI-driven research.

If you‚Äôre waiting for a buyer to show intent, you‚Äôre already too late. The real work happens long before they‚Äôre ready to buy.

Where are you showing up?

You‚Äôve just read the first of 8 posts on influencing the B2B buying decision. Follow

comments.commentText: The fact that most buying committees START with their shortlist already determined really changes when we need to get in the door with prospects.
A clear case for a solid thought leadership (trusted guide) strategy.
Very clever post my friend!

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Building early awareness and trust is crucial. It‚Äôs all about being top of mind before the decision-making begins!

postsData.name:
Nick G.
Nick G.
postsData.content:
great UX ~ great docs ~ great support.

Companies that nail all of the above tend to follow the same mindset.

That is: treat them all as "interfaces" - ways in which users use your product. API design falls in this bucket too.

When thought about this way, the same design principles apply:

1. Be self-explanatory
Even users unfamiliar with your product should be able to quickly grasp how to accomplish a task or use a feature. Use plain, scenario-driven language. It should be "obvious" what a button, feature, or interface does without being a product expert. Good example here: in SaaS UIs, I tend to prefer labeled buttons instead of icon-only buttons. They take guesswork out.

2. Be consistent
Repetition helps build intuition. For UIs, using a consistent design language and UI components builds cues on how things should function. Similar idea applies to docs and even marketing: terminology and messaging should be the same across any user touchpoint.

3. Think ahead
Often, a feature team will ship with a narrow scenario in mind driven by a specific customer ask or deliverable. While it's important to ship fast, it's also good to do a thought experiment on how other customers may want to accomplish similar or related scenarios in the future. This doesn't mean over-build, but doing this "look-ahead" process does often reveal more generalizable and cleaner design choices and abstractions that don't lock you into a corner.

Really great product-led teams cultivate a culture that thinks about all "Interfaces" with a similar level of consideration and craft.

comments.commentText: This speaks to my heart as a tech writer who also has to write all the UI text <3
Good stuff, Nick

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely! Consistency across all interfaces truly enhances user experience and fosters trust. Great insights on design principles!

postsData.name:
Brain Expansion Group
Brain Expansion Group
postsData.content:
Create a vision for the life you really want - then work relentlessly towards making it a reality.

This is something I live by.

When I decided to rebrand SickFitness last year, I didn‚Äôt jump straight into the work.
I spent months solely focused on creating a vision for the life I wanted.

I asked myself:

Ô∏è What do I want for myself and my family in the future?
Ô∏è What does that future look like?
Ô∏è How can I design my business around the life I desire for myself, my wife, and my stepdaughter?
Ô∏è How do all of these things fit together?

I saw myself in the future and engraved that snapshot in my mind.

It took time - months of deep thinking and refining my vision - but once I had clarity, everything changed.

 No more waking up and going through the motions.
 No more aimless effort without direction.
 A clear vision became my blueprint.

It gave structure to my days, helped me set short-term and long-term goals, and aligned my daily actions with my ultimate purpose.

postsData.name:
Anthony Escamilla
Anthony Escamilla
postsData.content:
Headcount Approval Process = Overlooked and Underdeveloped


Here‚Äôs what usually happens:

 Approval bottlenecks: Too many sign-off steps slow everything down.
 Inconsistent data: Missing or inaccurate info leads to poor decisions.
 Manual processes: Spreadsheets and emails are mistakes waiting to happen.
 Bad communication: Requests get lost in the shuffle, and updates are hard to track.
 No forecasting: A nonexistent long-term view makes hiring feel reactive, not strategic.
 Budget blind spots: Budget constraint confusion leads to delays or overspending.

The result?

Hiring delays. Missed opportunities. Teams stuck understaffed.

Or worse, overspending on roles that weren‚Äôt fully justified.

Here's how to fix it:

 Step 1: Align Before You Request
The Hiring Manager gets on the same page with the Head of Department about the new role. Then the HM submits the Headcount Request Form and explains in detail how this hire would impact company OKRs (annual planning or an ad-hoc request).

 Step 2: Benchmark the Role
Talent Acquisition tags HR Ops to run salary benchmarking based on the role‚Äôs requirements for budget alignment before things move forward.

 Step 3: Get Budget Approval
Once the salary data is in, the TA loops the HoD back in to approve the request‚Äîincluding budget considerations. No budget surprises down the line.

 Step 4: The Hiring Committee Review
After HoD approval, TA sends the request to the Hiring Committee. They review, approve, or reject the request. If rejected, detailed feedback goes back to the HM and HoD to keep things transparent.

‚àé Pro Tip: If the committee thinks the request lacks justification, they‚Äôll tag the HoD for more context. Still not enough? The request gets formally rejected‚Äîno gray areas.

Easy. At least, it should be.

The biggest problem I see is 'Who's in charge of actually setting up the steps?'

So here's my question:

What's really slowing down your headcount approval process? Is it lacking one or all of the steps? Or waiting on an unknown person to set up the steps in the first place?
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Streamlining the headcount approval process is essential for agility. Clear steps and accountability can transform hiring efficiency! üöÄ
